#Text=VIII
#Text=This time of Levi West 's unwelcome visitation was indeed a time of bitter trouble and tribulation to poor Hiram White .
#Text=Money was of very different value in those days than it is now , and five hundred pounds was in its way a good round lump -- in Sussex County it was almost a fortune .
#Text=It was a desperate struggle for Hiram to raise the amount of his father 's bequest to his stepbrother .

#Text=Squire Hall , as may have been gathered , had a very warm and friendly feeling for Hiram , believing in him when all others disbelieved ; nevertheless , in the matter of money the old man was as hard and as cold as adamant .
#Text=He would , he said , do all he could to help Hiram , but that five hundred pounds must and should be raised -- Hiram must release his security bond .
#Text=He would loan him , he said , three hundred pounds , taking a mortgage upon the mill .
#Text=He would have lent him four hundred but that there was already a first mortgage of one hundred pounds upon it , and he would not dare to put more than three hundred more atop of that .
#Text=Hiram had a considerable quantity of wheat which he had bought upon speculation and which was then lying idle in a Philadelphia storehouse .
#Text=This he had sold at public sale and at a very great sacrifice ; he realized barely one hundred pounds upon it .
#Text=The financial horizon looked very black to him ; nevertheless , Levi 's five hundred pounds was raised , and paid into Squire Hall 's hands , and Squire Hall released Hiram 's bond .
#Text=The business was finally closed on one cold , gray afternoon in the early part of December .
#Text=As Hiram tore his bond across and then tore it across again and again , Squire Hall pushed back the papers upon his desk and cocked his feet upon its slanting top .
#Text=" Hiram , " said he , abruptly , " Hiram , do you know that Levi West is forever hanging around Billy Martin 's house , after that pretty daughter of his ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Well , he is , " said Squire Hall .

column1: #Text=" It 's the talk of the whole neighborhood .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Hiram said not a word , but he sat looking at the other in stolid silence .

#Text= That stepbrother of yours , " continued the old Squire presently , " is a rascal -- he is a rascal , Hiram , and I mis-doubt he 's something worse .

_	_	_	_

#Text=He stopped again , and still Hiram said nothing .

#Text= And look'ee , Hiram , " the old man resumed , suddenly , " I do hear that you be courtin ' the girl , too ; is that so ?

_	_	_	_

#Text= Yes , " said Hiram , " I 'm courtin ' her , too .

column1: #Text=I 'm afraid your cakes are dough .
